item.title: Vulnerable Moxa devices expose industrial networks to attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Industrial networking and communications provider Moxa is warning of a high-severity and a critical vulnerability that impact various models of its cellular routers, secure routers, and network security appliances. [...]

item.title: Chinese hackers also breached Charter and Windstream networks
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​More U.S. companies have been added to the list of telecommunications firms hacked in a wave of breaches by a Chinese state-backed threat group tracked as Salt Typhoon. [...]

item.title: Eagerbee backdoor deployed against Middle Eastern govt orgs, ISPs
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: New variants of the Eagerbee malware framework are being deployed against government organizations and internet service providers (ISPs) in the Middle East. [...]

item.title: Microsoft Bing shows misleading Google-like page for 'Google' searches
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: Microsoft Bing is displaying what is being categorized as a misleading Google-esque search page when users search for Google, making it look you are on the competing search engine. [...]

item.title: Microsoft may have scrapped Windows 11's dynamic wallpapers feature
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Microsoft has many good ideas for Windows 11 that often do not ship, and one of them was "Dynamic Wallpapers," which, as the name suggests, could have made the wallpaper dynamic, similar to third-party tools like Lively Wallpaper. [...]

item.title: Windows 10 users urged to upgrade to avoid "security fiasco"
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: ​Cybersecurity firm ESET is urging Windows 10 users to upgrade to Windows 11 or Linux to avoid a "security fiasco" as the 10-year-old operating system nears the end of support in October 2025. [...]

item.title: Cryptocurrency wallet drainers stole $494 million in 2024
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Scammers stole $494 million worth of cryptocurrency in wallet drainer attacks last year that targeted more than 300,000 wallet addresses. [...]

item.title: Nuclei flaw lets malicious templates bypass signature verification
item.dc:creator: Lawrence Abrams
item.description: A now-fixed vulnerability in the open-source vulnerability scanner Nuclei could potentially allow attackers to bypass signature verification while sneaking malicious code into templates that execute on local systems. [...]

item.title: Google Chrome is making it easier to share specific parts of long PDFs
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google is adding the Text Fragment feature to its PDF reader to make it easier to share specific parts of long PDFs. [...]

item.title: New FireScam Android data-theft malware poses as Telegram Premium app
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A new Android malware named 'FireScam' is being distributed as a premium version of the Telegram app via phishing websites on GitHub that mimick the RuStore, Russia's app market for mobile devices. [...]

item.title: Bad Tenable plugin updates take down Nessus agents worldwide
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Tenable says customers must manually upgrade their software to revive Nessus vulnerability scanner agents taken offline on December 31st due to buggy differential plugin updates. [...]

item.title: US sanctions Chinese company linked to Flax Typhoon hackers
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​The U.S. Treasury Department has sanctioned Beijing-based cybersecurity company Integrity Tech (also known as Yongxin Zhicheng) for its involvement in cyberattacks attributed to the Chinese state-sponsored Flax Typhoon hacking group. [...]
